title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: Contributing to blob
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to blob
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("batpigandme/blob", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to blob
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to blob
text: Please note blob project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wickham H (2024). blob: Simple S3 Class Representing Vectors Binary Data ('BLOBS'). R package version 1.2.4.9009, https://github.com/tidyverse/blob, https://blob.tidyverse.org.
code: @Manual{,   title = {blob: A Simple S3 Class for Representing Vectors of Binary Data ('BLOBS')},   author = {Hadley Wickham},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.4.9009, https://github.com/tidyverse/blob},   url = {https://blob.tidyverse.org}, }

title: A Simple S3 Class for Representing Vectors of Binary Data (BLOBS)
text: goal blob provide simple S3 class represent vector binary objects, aka blobs. blob class lightweight wrapper around list raw vectors, suitable inclusion data frame. cases need use package explicitly: used transparently packages need load BLOB columns databases binary file formats.

title: A Simple S3 Class for Representing Vectors of Binary Data (BLOBS)
code: # The easiest way to get blob is to install the whole tidyverse: install.packages("tidyverse")  # Alternatively, install just blob: install.packages("blob")  # Or the the development version from GitHub: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("tidyverse/blob")

title: A Simple S3 Class for Representing Vectors of Binary Data (BLOBS)
text: create blob, use blob(), new_blob() as_blob(): Please note ‘blob’ project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
code: library(blob)  x1 <- charToRaw("Good morning") x2 <- as.raw(c(0x48, 0x65, 0x6c, 0x6c, 0x6f))  new_blob(list(x1, x2)) #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[5 B] blob(x1, x2) #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[5 B]  as_blob(c("Good morning", "Good evening")) #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[12 B]

title: Deprecated generic — as.blob
text: .blob() generic deprecated favor as_blob() function (users) vec_cast.blob() method (implementers). Implement vec_cast.blob.myclass() method support coercing objects class blobs. See vctrs::vec_cast() detail.

title: Deprecated generic — as.blob
text: x object. ... Passed methods.

title: Construct a blob object — blob
text: new_blob() low-level constructor takes list raw vectors. blob() constructs blob individual raw vectors. as_blob() is_blob() simple forwarders vctrs::vec_cast() inherits(), respectively.

title: Construct a blob object — blob
code: blob(...)  new_blob(x = list())  validate_blob(x)  as_blob(x)  is_blob(x)

title: Construct a blob object — blob
text: ... Individual raw vectors x list raw vectors, object coerce

title: Construct a blob object — blob
code: x1 <- charToRaw("Good morning") x2 <- as.raw(c(0x48, 0x65, 0x6c, 0x6c, 0x6f))  new_blob(list(x1, x2)) #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[5 B]  blob(x1, x2) #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[5 B]   as.blob(c("Good morning", "Good evening")) #> Warning: as.blob() is deprecated, use as_blob(). #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> <blob[2]> #> [1] blob[12 B] blob[12 B]

text: CRAN release: 2022-04-10 as_blob(NA_character_) returns missing blob instead as_blob("NA") (#26, @michaelchirico).

title: blob 1.2.2 (2021-07-23)
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-23 Moved “stable” lifecycle stage. Remove is_vector_s3() (#19).

title: blob 1.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-20 Inline prettyunits. vec_ptype2.hms.default() forwards vec_default_ptype2() compatibility vctrs 0.2.1.

title: blob 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-09

title: blob 1.2.0
text: blob class now based list_of(raw()) vctrs package (#11). adds support vec_cast() vec_ptype2(). operations (subset assignment) now stricter. new_blob() constructor permits safe fast construction blob objects list, validate_blob() checks existing object conformity rules. new is_blob() deprecates existing .blob(). .blob() deprecated favor vec_cast() new as_blob() (just thin wrapper around vec_cast()). Indexing vector blobs bounds now raises error. Use NA index create NULL blob.

title: blob 1.1.1 (2018-03-24)
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-25 Now suggesting pillar instead importing tibble, using colored formatting prettyunits package B instead b units (#7, #9). blob class can now used S4 dispatch. Calling c() blob objects returns blob.

title: blob 1.1.0 (2017-06-17)
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-17 New maintainer: Kirill Müller. Added .blob.blob().data.frame.blob() methods (#3). Size large blobs displayed correctly.

title: blob 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-12-28 Initial release.
